message.content:
To extract the carrying amount of inventories sold during the reporting period, we need to focus on the financial statements provided, particularly the income statement.

First, we locate the relevant line item in the income statement, which is the "Cost of Goods Sold" (COGS). COGS represents the direct costs attributable to the production of the goods sold in a company. It includes the carrying amount of inventories sold.

Looking at the income statement provided:

### income statement
| Account | Amount | Date |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Main Business Revenue | 5760023.09 | 2024-01-28 |
| Total Revenue | 5760023.09 | 2024-01-28 |
| Cost of Goods Sold | 3140000.00 | 2024-01-28 |
| Total Cost | 3140000.00 | 2024-01-28 |
| Gross Profit | 2620023.09 | 2024-01-28 |
| Administrative Expenses | 286483.51 | 2024-01-28 |
| Selling Expenses | 793728.19 | 2024-01-28 |
| Depreciation | 45760.13 | 2024-01-28 |
| Financial Expenses | 112130.48 | 2024-01-28 |
| Total Expenses | 1238102.31 | 2024-01-28 |
| Interest Income | 11346.19 | 2024-01-28 |
| Profit Before Tax | 1393266.97 | 2024-01-28 |
| Tax Expense | 288001.20 | 2024-01-28 |
| Net Profit | 1105265.77 | 2024-01-28 |

From this table, we identify that the "Cost of Goods Sold" is **3140000.00**.

This amount represents the carrying amount of inventories sold during the reporting period.

Now, we can present our answer in the required JSON format.

```json
{"solution": {'value': '3140000.00'} }
```
